analyst.problem_statement: The research paper (paper.md) contains 111 citations but lacks systematic validation to ensure: (1) every claim has a supporting reference, (2) references have accessible URLs, (3) URLs contain scrapable content, and (4) the content actually supports the claims made.
analyst.primary_users: Paper authors, reviewers, and academic readers who need to verify claims are properly supported by citations
analyst.success_criteria: 100% of quantitative claims have citations; all reference URLs return 200 OK; validation report identifies any unsupported claims

functional_requirements.name: Claim Extraction
functional_requirements.description: Parse paper.md to identify all statements that require citations (statistics, quotes, assertions)

functional_requirements.name: Reference Parsing
functional_requirements.description: Extract all references and their URLs from the References section

functional_requirements.name: URL Validation
functional_requirements.description: Check each reference URL for accessibility and scrape text content

functional_requirements.name: Claim Verification
functional_requirements.description: Compare claims against scraped content to verify support
acceptance_criteria: Match claim text to reference content

functional_requirements.name: Report Generation
functional_requirements.description: Generate comprehensive markdown report of validation results

analyst.performance_requirements: Complete validation within 10 minutes for 111 references
analyst.scalability_requirements: Handle papers with up to 200 citations
analyst.constraints: Python stdlib only (no requests, beautifulsoup, etc.)
analyst.assumptions: Reference URLs are publicly accessible; paper.md follows established citation format
